    1. wrap()

Interface Wrappable<W>

Type Parameters:
W - the type the lambda is wrapped in
All Known Subinterfaces:
ExceptionalBiConsumer<T,U,E>, ExceptionalBiFunction<T,U,R,E>, ExceptionalBinaryOperator<T,E>, ExceptionalBiPredicate<T,U,E>, ExceptionalBooleanSupplier<E>, ExceptionalConsumer<T,E>, ExceptionalDoubleBinaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalDoubleConsumer<E>, ExceptionalDoubleFunction<R,E>, ExceptionalDoublePredicate<E>, ExceptionalDoubleSupplier<E>, ExceptionalDoubleToIntFunction<E>, ExceptionalDoubleToLongFunction<E>, ExceptionalDoubleUnaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalFunction<T,R,E>, ExceptionalIntBinaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalIntConsumer<E>, ExceptionalIntFunction<R,E>, ExceptionalIntPredicate<E>, ExceptionalIntSupplier<E>, ExceptionalIntToDoubleFunction<E>, ExceptionalIntToLongFunction<E>, ExceptionalIntUnaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalLongBinaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalLongConsumer<E>, ExceptionalLongFunction<R,E>, ExceptionalLongPredicate<E>, ExceptionalLongSupplier<E>, ExceptionalLongToDoubleFunction<E>, ExceptionalLongToIntFunction<E>, ExceptionalLongUnaryOperator<E>, ExceptionalObjDoubleConsumer<T,E>, ExceptionalObjIntConsumer<T,E>, ExceptionalObjLongConsumer<T,E>, ExceptionalPredicate<T,E>, ExceptionalRunnable<E>, ExceptionalSupplier<T,E>, ExceptionalToDoubleBiFunction<T,U,E>, ExceptionalToDoubleFunction<T,E>, ExceptionalToIntBiFunction<T,U,E>, ExceptionalToIntFunction<T,E>, ExceptionalToLongBiFunction<T,U,E>, ExceptionalToLongFunction<T,E>, ExceptionalUnaryOperator<T,E>
public interface Wrappable<W>
Interfaces which extend this can wrap a lambda using the wrap() method, allowing it to be used in contexts where exceptions are not allowed to be thrown directly.

If a checked exception is thrown, a WrappedExceptionalException, which is a runtime exception, will be thrown instead. This will have the original exception as its cause.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    W
    wrap()
    Wraps this lambda, allowing it to be used in contexts where exceptions are not allowed to be thrown directly.

  • Method Details

    • wrap

      W wrap()
      Wraps this lambda, allowing it to be used in contexts where exceptions are not allowed to be thrown directly.

      If a checked exception is thrown, a WrappedExceptionalException, which is a runtime exception, will be thrown instead. This will have the original exception as its cause.

      Returns:
      a wrapped instance of type W
